item.title: Report E-2024050255
item.description:
Report E-2024050255

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-15T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-27
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XKC. It was reported that approximately 3 gallons of Prep-All Wax & Grease Remover were released from (1) box containing (4) 1-gallon metal cans due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted a total of 9 boxes and the concrete dock floor.

item.title: Report E-2024050125
item.description:
Report E-2024050125

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN3018 Pilot 4E release from a 250-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to two 2’ x 2’ areas of the trailer floor due to a puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged tote was dried with absorbents for disposal. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
